result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns

defendant.name: Hurns, Calvin Walter-Isaiah

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Ricci appeared by video for Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Ricci has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Calvin Hurns - #2022009643, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant does not appear, in custody at HOC. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, bail to revert to $12,000.00.  If alternative Cash Bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No contact order monitoring.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Calvin Walter-Isaiah Hurns in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
